name: Tritons
tagline: Welcome to our team RoboCup website!
body:
## About Team Triton is collection of faculty and students from [UC San Diego](https://ucsd.edu/) within the [Contextual Robotics Institute](http://jacobsschool.ucsd.edu/contextualrobotics/) formed to compete in [RoboCup@Home](http://www.robocupathome.org/); a league aiming to develop service and assistive robot technology with high relevance for future personal domestic applications. ## Members Our team is compromised of robotics professors and graduate students including: * [Dr. Henrik I. Christensen](http://www.hichristensen.net/) * Professor of Computer Science at Dept. of Computer Science and Engineering UC San Diego and director of the Institute for Contextual Robotics. Dr. Christensen does research on systems integration, human-robot interaction, mapping and robot vision, with a strong emphasis on "real problems with real solutions". * [Dr. Laurel Riek](http://cseweb.ucsd.edu/~lriek/) * Associate Professor of Computer Science and Engineering at UC San Diego. She is a roboticist with interests in human-robot interaction, computer vision, and healthcare engineering, and focuses on designing systems able to sense, respond, and adapt to people. * [Darren Chan](http://darrenmchan.com/) * PhD student in the Robotics, Health, and Communication (RHC) Lab in CSE at the UC San Diego working under the direction of Dr. Laurel Riek. Darren's research explores selective attention for robots, as an approach to allow robots to understand the world more efficiently and more robustly. * [Tariq Iqbal](http://cseweb.ucsd.edu/~tiqbal/) * PhD candidate in the Robotics, Health, and Communication (RHC) Lab in CSE at the UC San Diego working under the direction of Dr. Laurel Riek. Tariq's research interest includes modeling team dynamics and coordination phenomena within human-robot cooperation and designed adaptive non-linear algorithms to sense activity emergence with people in real time. * [Angelique Taylor](http://cseweb.ucsd.edu/~amt062/) * PhD student in the Robotics, Health, and Communication (RHC) Lab in CSE at the UC San Diego working under the direction of Dr. Laurel Riek. Angelique's research lies in the intersection of computer vision, robotics, and artificial intelligence to design algorithms for robots to learn how to behave in human spaces via social context. * [Priyam Parashar]() * PhD student in the Cognitive Robotics (CogRob) Lab in CSE at the UC San Diego working under the direction of Dr. Henrik Christensen. Priyam's research interest includes human robot integration is mobile navigation and social behavioral learning from human demonstration. * [Shengye Wang](http://cseweb.ucsd.edu/~shengye/) * PhD student in the Cognitive Robotics (CogRob) Lab in CSE at the UC San Diego working under the direction of Dr. Henrik Christensen. Shengye's research interest includes robotic system architecture, contextual and cognitive autonomy, human-computer interaction, and software engineering. * [Ruffin White](https://about.me/ruffin) * PhD student in the Cognitive Robotics (CogRob) Lab in CSE at the UC San Diego working under the direction of Dr. Henrik Christensen. Ruffin's research interests include long-term autonomy, repeatable/reproducible research, robotic cyber-security, as well as open source robotics. ## Software Team Triton builds upon a number of past open source software project: * [OmniMapper](https://github.com/CognitiveRobotics/omnimapper) * OmniMapper is an open source SLAM and mapping library and framework developed by the Cognitive Robotics Lab. The mapping library aims to support a wide array of mapping tasks, ranging from scan matching based pose graphs to 3D feature-based maps annotated with semantic information. It has been designed with modularity in mind, so as to provide solutions to multi-modal mapping problems with any sensors that may be available. * [Edge Based Tracking library](https://github.com/CognitiveRobotics/object_tracking_2D) * EBT is a library of C++ classes that implement edge based object tracking in robotics and vision, using textureless object detection and tracking of the 3D pose. Detection and tracking schemes are coherently integrated in a particle filtering framework on the special Euclidean group, SE(3), in which the visual tracking problem is tackled by maintaining multiple hypotheses of the object pose. * [SROS](http://discourse.ros.org/t/announcing-sros-security-enhancements-for-ros/536) * SROS is a proposed addition to the ROS API and ecosystem to support modern cryptography and security measures, including: over-the-wire cryptography for all data transport, namespaced access control enforcing graph policies/restrictions, and finally process profiles using Linux Security Modules to harden a node’s resource access.

Bibliography

Althaus, P., H. Ishiguro, T. Kanda, T. Miyashita, and H.I. Christensen. 2004. “Navigation for Human-Robot Interaction Tasks.” In IEEE Intl. Conf. on Robotics and Automation - 04, 1894–1900. New Orleans.

Bonsignorio, Fabio, and Angel P. del Pobil. 2015. “Toward Replicable and Measurable Robotics Research.” IEEE Robotics & Automation Magazine 22 (3): 32–35. doi:10.1109/MRA.2015.2452073.

Chan, Taylor, D., and L.D. Riek. 2017. “An RGB-d Region Proposal Generator for Faster Robot Perception.” In Review.

Choi, C., and H. I. Christensen. 2012. “Robust 3D Visual Tracking Using Particle Filtering on the Special Euclidean Group: A Combined Approach of Keypoint and Edge Features.” Intl. Jour. of Robotics Research 31 (4): 498–519.

Choi, Changhyun, and Henrik I Christensen. 2016. “RGB-d Object Pose Estimation in Unstructured Environments.” Robotics and Autonomous Systems 75 (1): 595–613.

Choudhary, S., L. Carlone, C. Nieto, J. Rogers, Z. Liu, H. I. Christensen, and Frank Dellaert. 2016. “Multi Robot Object-Based SLAM.” In Intl. Symp. on Experimental Robotics. Tokyo, JP: IFRR.

Cosgun, A., A. Sisbot, and H. I. Christensen. 2016. “Anticipatory Robot Path Planning in Human Environments.” In The 25th IEEE International Symposium on Robot and Human Interactive Communication. New York, NY: IEEE.

Cosgun, Akansel, Dinei A Florencio, and Henrik I Christensen. 2013. “Autonomous Person Following for Telepresence Robots.” In Robotics and Automation (ICRA), 2013 IEEE International Conference on, 4335–42. IEEE.

Dellaert, Frank. 2012. “Factor Graphs and GTSAM: A Hands-on Introduction.” Georgia Institute of Technology.

Ferrer, Gonzalo, Anaís Garrell Zulueta, Fernando Herrero Cotarelo, and Alberto Sanfeliu. 2016. “Robot Social-Aware Navigation Framework to Accompany People Walking Side-by-Side.” Autonomous Robots. Springer, 1–19.

Guglielmelli, Eugenio. 2015. “Research Reproducibility and Performance Evaluation for Dependable Robots.” IEEE Robotics & Automation Magazine 22 (3): 4–4. doi:10.1109/MRA.2015.2470815.

Huaman, A., H. Ben-Amor, and H. I. Christensen. 2016. “Combining Arm and Hand Metrics for Sensible Grasp Modeling.” In Conf. on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE). Austin, TX: IEEE.

Iqbal, T., S. Rack, and L. D. Riek. 2016. “Movement Coordination in Human-Robot Teams: A Dynamical Systems Approach.” IEEE Transactions on Robotics 32 (4): 909–19. doi:10.1109/TRO.2016.2570240.

Iqbal, Tariq, and Laurel D Riek. 2016. “A Method for Automatic Detection of Psychomotor Entrainment.” IEEE Transactions on Affective Computing 7 (1). IEEE: 3–16.

Iqbal, Tariq, Maryam Moosaei, and Laurel D Riek. 2016. “Tempo Adaptation and Anticipation Methods for Human-Robot Teams.” Robotics, Science and Systems (RSS) 2016 Workshop on Planning for Human-Robot Interaction.

Nigam, Aastha, and Laurel D Riek. 2015. “Social Context Perception for Mobile Robots.” In Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS), 2015 IEEE/RSJ International Conference on, 3621–7. IEEE.

O’Connor, Maria Francesca, and Laurel D Riek. 2015. “Detecting Social Context: A Method for Social Event Classification Using Naturalistic Multimodal Data.” Automatic Face and Gesture Recognition (FG), 2015 11th IEEE International Conference and Workshops on 3. IEEE: 1–7.

Pacchierotti, E., H. I. Christensen, and P. Jensfelt. 2006. “Design of an Office-Guide Robot for Social Interaction Studies.” In Intl Conf on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS). Beijing, China: RSJ/IEEE.

Taylor, A., and L. D. Riek. 2016. “Robot Perception of Human Groups in the Real World: State of the Art.” In Proceedings of the AAAI Fall Symposium on Artificial Intelligence in Human-Robot Interaction (AI-HRI).

Trevor, Alexander J B, John G. Rogers III, and Henrik Iskov Christensen. 2014. “OmniMapper: A Modular Multimodal Mapping Framework.” In ICRA. Hong Kong: IEEE/RSJ.

White, Ruffin, Morgan Quigley, and Henrik Christensen. 2016. “SROS: Securing ROS over the Wire, in the Graph, and Through the Kernel.” In Humanoids Workshop: Towards Humanoid Robots OS. Cancun, Mexico.
